questions.question: Effective customer service is most likely to be achieved through which two of the following?
Which two are the most likely advantages to a business of using venture capital?

choices.answer: They do not interfere with the running of the business.
There is a opportunity to benefit from expensive advice.
Venture capitalists do not pay tax.
It increases access to finance for small businesses.

questions.question: Which one of the following is an example of short-term finance for a small business?
Which 2 are examples of risks which increase the chance of a a new business failing?

choices.answer: Variable costs turn out to be lower than forecast
The bank increases interest rates on business loans
There is less competition than expected in the local area
Net cash flow turns out to be negative

questions.question: Identify two non-financial objectives when starting a business.
Which two of the following should an entrepreneur ask to find out about customer demand?

choices.answer: What is the average level of income of local people?
What if fixed costs increase in the first 6 months?
What type of promotion should I use?
How Many people live in the area?

questions.question: Which 2 of the following might be sources of added value for a newsagent business?

choices.answer: Only newsagent providing deliveries of a daily paper
Paying high weekly wages to workers
Opening later every weekday and weekend

questions.question: Which 2 of the following are key features of enterprise?

choices.answer: Having the right qualifications to run a business
Having a willingness to take on new ventures

questions.question: Which 2 of the following sources of finance would be appropriate for a start-up?
Identify 2 possible disadvantages of operating a business as a franchise.

choices.answer: The cost of the initial investment can be high.
Franchises have to take out a patent.
Franchises have to pay a higher rate of VAT.
A lack of freedom for the owner in making decisions.

questions.question: Deliberate creativity involves which two of the following techniques?

choices.answer: Starting a business which provides a service.

questions.question: Which one of the following is the best definition of a stakeholder?

choices.answer: The shareholders of a limited company who receive dividends
Any individual or group with an interest in the business
Anyone who works within a business
A person or group able to influence business decisions

questions.question: Which one of the following is the definition of innovation?

choices.answer: Bringing a new idea to a market.

questions.question: Identify one disadvantage of unlimited liability.

choices.answer: The need to pay higher taxes.
The need to share profit with the other shareholders.

questions.question: Which two of the following are methods of protecting business ideas?
Which 3 of the following are examples of market segmentation for a small sports retailer?

choices.answer: Young members of local sports teams.
Individuals with interests in specialist sports.
An advertisement in a local paper.
Manager of a local netball team.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of primary research?
Which 2 of the following would not be needed in a business plan?

choices.answer: Name and address of all employees
An overview nature of the business.

questions.question: Which two of the following are example of lateral thinking techniques?

choices.answer: Brainstorming business ideas with a group.
Providing a wide range of products.

questions.question: Which two of the following are examples of goods?
